title: The Dax Riggs Collection part 2 (Daisyhead)
description:
This torrent contains both known recordings of the band Daisyhead and the Mooncrickets.

Daisyhead & The Mooncrickets was a project of Dax Riggs in 1997 that never took off. Only two recordings are known to exist. One is a self-titled 14 track recording, where most of the songs are cut off before they end. A few covers are included, such as David Bowie&#039;s "Ziggy Stardust". Most of the song titles are unknown. It is also the earliest recording of the "Deadboy & the Elephantmen Theme Song," which Riggs would sometimes play when he formed a band by that name in late 2000.

The other album is Skeletal Circus Derails which later inspired the name of the Dax Riggs fan site SkeletalCircus.com.

Daisyhead & the Mooncrickets is akin to an urban legend for fans of underground bluesy rock. But the two works, especially Skeletal Circus Derails are an important chapter in Riggs&#039; history. Fans to this day regularly ask him to play certain songs from that album when they see him on tour.

They also detail a point in Riggs&#039; career when he&#039;s struggling for life after Acid Bath disbanded in 1997. Toward the end of that metal group, Riggs was pushing for a more melodic sound, which materializes in his subsequent bands Agents of Oblivion and Deadboy & the Elephantmen. This sound was first born on the Daisyhead & The Mooncrickets recordings.
